title: If there are black and white Jews, how did 'Jew' become a race? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are no “white Jews”. Not unless you count recent converts. And even if you do, we’re talking less than 3,000 people here (hell, probably less than ONE thousand). And I am only pointing this out because “white Jew” is all too often used as a shorthand for “Ashkenazi”. And this is just wrong, not to mention quite dangerous. Ashkenazi Jews are not white. They are Middle Eastern. Exile to Europe did not change their race. Oded Fehr is an Ashkenazi Jew whose parents made aliyah from Germany/Holland. He is obviously not white.  Jeff Goldblum is an Ashkenazi Jew from the United States. Does he look white?  Ben Schwartz is an Ashkenazi Jew. Obviously not white.  Jazz Jennings is also an Ashkenazi Jew. She’s clearly not white.  Of course, there are Ashkenazim who look white, but most who do are products of recent intermarriage (i.e. half-Ashkenazi/half-white, like Scarlett Johanssen). There are also plenty of non-Jewish Levantines who look white. Google Syrians, Lebanese Maronites, Druze, Samaritans, etc and you’ll see what I mean. But I digress. Here’s what our racial breakdown looks like… Ashkenazi Jews - Middle Eastern. Sephardi Jews - Middle Eastern. Mizrahi Jews - Middle Eastern. North American Jews - Mainly of Ashkenazi descent, but not entirely. Furthermore, most American Jews are products of intermarriage (e.g. they have an Ashkenazi mother and a white-English father, or something like that). South American Jews - Mostly of Ashkenazi and/or Sephardi descent. Australian Jews - Mostly Ashkenazi. 99% of the world’s Jews fall into one or more of those subgroups, all of whom are Middle Eastern. As for the others… Beta Israel - Black. Bene Israel - South Asian/Middle Eastern. Kaifeng Jews - East Asian. Converts - Can be white, or of any race. But it must be emphasized that 99% of the world’s Jews are NOT converts. The above four groups collectively number about 200–300 thousand. That’s 200–300 thousand out of at least 12–15 million Jews. Now for the main question: we were never a race, although I suppose it depends on how one defines “race”. We are certainly as much of a “race” as Arabs, Persians, Latinos, and Native Americans are. But we’re not a “race” in the sense that Africans, East Asians, and white people are races. We’re an ethnoreligious tribal group (Tribes of Judah and Levi with Benjamin and Simeon mixed in) and nation. And like most nations, the vast majority of us belong to a single ethnicity, indigenous to a specific place (in our case, Judea/Israel). Hope that clarifies things. And I hope that was easy to understand. It’s pretty late where I am, so forgive any grammatical mistakes.

“Jew” is not “a race” but… Jews are “ethnoreligious group” or more correctly - set of several such groups… Ethnoreligious group is defined in Wikipedia as “an ethnic group whose members are also unified by a common religious background”. Contemporary Judaism in almost all its versions is non-proselytizing so while people of all “races” (not that human “races” is valid biological concept anyway…) can become Jews, vast majority are having common ethnic background. There’re ~15 -16 million Jews in the world. Over 6 million of them are living in Israel. So when non-Israeli meets someone Jewish it’s almost certainly someone of very specific ethnic background as of the ~9 millions living outside Israel over ~7 million are specifically Ashkenazi Jews. Also Sephardi Jews which are second largest group outside Israel are having clear ties and similarity to Ashkenazi Jews. So Jews is not only religion but also ethnicity. Moreover in many cases Jews are more ethnicity than religion. Or even almost exclusively ethnicity with little relation to religion. As many people would remind - Nazis were killing all those “ethnically Jewish” even if converted to Christianity for several generations. I can bring another example. In Soviet Union and socialist countries of Eastern Europe anti-Semitism had precisely nothing to do with a faith, it was totally ethnic/ quasi-racist.
